meanings.definition: To create or use slogans in order to promote a cause or idea.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys sloganising for her school events to get more people to attend.
meanings.sent2: The marketing team is sloganising the new product to attract customers.
meanings.sent3: The students had fun sloganising for the charity fundraiser.
meanings.sent4: His way of sloganising made the campaign stand out from the rest.
meanings.sent5: By sloganising effectively, the organization gained widespread support.

meanings.definition: The act of using catchy phrases or slogans to convey a message.
meanings.sent1: The success of the campaign was due to the clever sloganising.
meanings.sent2: Effective sloganising can make a brand memorable to consumers.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the best sloganising was fierce among the teams.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for sloganising made her the go-to person for advertising ideas.
meanings.sent5: The power of good sloganising can influence public opinion greatly.
